RTCTrackEvent.summary: The WebRTC API interface RTCTrackEvent represents the event, which is sent when a new is added to an which is part of the .

remarks.para: The target is the RTCPeerConnection object to which the track is being added.
This event is sent by the WebRTC layer to the website or application, so you will not typically need to instantiate an RTCTrackEvent yourself.

RTCTrackEventReceiver.summary:
The read-only receiver property
of the interface indicates the
which is used to receive data containing media for the
to which the event refers.
RTCTrackEventReceiver.value:
The which pairs the receiver with a
sender and other properties which establish a single bidirectional RTP
stream for use by the associated with the
RTCTrackEvent.
NOTEThe
includes its own property, which
will always be the same as this one.

RTCTrackEventRTCTrackEvent.summary:
The RTCTrackEvent() constructor creates and returns a new object,
configured to describe the track which has been added to the .

remarks.para:
In general, you won't need to use this constructor, as RTCTrackEvent
objects are created by WebRTC and delivered to your RTCPeerConnection's
event handler as appropriate.

RTCTrackEventRTCTrackEvent.returns:
A new describing a track which has been added to the
RTCPeerConnection.

RTCTrackEventStreams.summary:
The WebRTC API
interface 's read-only
streams property specifies an array of
objects, one for each of the streams that comprise the
track being added to the .
RTCTrackEventStreams.value:
An {{jsxref("Array")}} of objects, one for each stream that
make up the new track.

RTCTrackEventTrack.summary:
The WebRTC API
interface 's read-only track
property specifies the that has been added to the
.
RTCTrackEventTrack.value:
A indicating the track which has been added to the
.
